descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with intravenous thrombolysis in treating acute ischemic stroke.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription: In this study, cases of ischemic stroke who undergo intravenous thrombolysis within 4.5 hours from onset are included. The experimental group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning for 200mmHg, 2 times within 6 hours to 24 hours from thrombolysis. The control group receive basic treatment and remote ischemic conditioning control for 60mmHg, 2 times within 6 hours to 24 hours from thrombolysis . Two groups will be followed up for 90 days to evaluate the efficacy and safety of remote ischemic conditioning combined with intravenous thrombolysis in treating acute ischemic stroke.

armGroups.label: RIC group
armGroups.description: RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min re-perfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 200 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice within 6 to 24 hours from thrombolysis. Additionally,the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014.

armGroups.label: control group
armGroups.description: Sham RIC+Standard medical treatment Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min re-perfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 60 mm Hg. RIC will be conducted twice twice within 6 to 24 hours from thrombolysis. Additionally,the patients will be treated with standard medical treatment according to Guidelines for diagnosis and treatment of acute ischemic stroke in China 2014

interventions.name: remote ischemic conditioning
interventions.description: Remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min re-perfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 200 mm Hg.

interventions.name: sham remote ischemic conditioning
interventions.description: Sham remote ischemic conditioning (RIC) is induced by 4 cycles of 5 min of healthy upper limb ischemia followed by 5 min re-perfusion. Limb ischemia was induced by inflation of a blood pressure cuff to 60 mm Hg.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Frequency of adverse events during hospitalization
primaryOutcomes.description: All adverse events until day-7 or discharge (whichever is earlier)

primaryOutcomes.measure: Frequency of adverse events during follow-up
primaryOutcomes.description: Severe adverse events through day-90 after the onset of acute ischemic stroke.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at 7 days from onset or discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at 7 days from onset or discharge. Ranged from 0 to 42, a low value represents a better outcome.

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Proportion of patients with Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) Score 0-2
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of patients with Modified Rankin Scale (mRS) Score 0-2. Ranged from 0 to 6, a low value represents a better outcome.

otherOutcomes.description: Hematological samples are collected at right before thrombolysis and 24 hours after thrombolysis, and changes of hematological indicators related to hemorrhagic transformation (such as Axl, ANGPTL4) are compared between the two groups.

otherOutcomes.measure: Changes of the function of dynamic cerebral autoregulation
otherOutcomes.description: The function of patients' dynamic cerebral autoregulation are tested 3 times within 10 days from onset and compared between the two groups.
